intro: Stenandrium diamantinense, commonly known as the Diamond Mountains stenandrium, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
